description: A very large tree with a buttressed, spreading base and horizontally spreading branches. Leaves are simple, without stipules, 7.5-15 cm long, 4-7 cm wide; petioles are very short. Flowers in terminal panicles; No petals availble , honey is scented. An indehiscent drupe, 3.5-5 cm long, obovate-ovoid, endocarp fibrous and woody, dark brown; contains solitary seed.

Shrub or small tree, spiny. Leaf, flower buds are often reddish or purplish; petiole are narrowly winged. Fruit ovoid colors light to deep yellow; pulp greenish to yellowish; contains sour juice  and small seeds.

A small tree or shrub. Bark is grey and rust-brown with a bright yellow-green crownwith hanging leaves and twigs. Twigs are sharply angled or winged. Leaf lamina 4-10x2.5-6 cm; nerves 7-15 pairs; petiole 2-7 mm long. Flower diameter is 3 cm . Fruit exceeds diameter of 3 cm when ripen.

Large shrub or canopy tree, About 25m tall. Contains slender twigs , terete, cream. Leaves are pale yellowish green with size of 6.5-11 x 2.5-5 cm. Cymes are 10 cm long, terminal or axillary.  Petal size is about 4 x 3 mm, white. Fruit size is about 12(-20) x 8(-14) mm.Turns purple when ripen.

Shrub or small tree up to about 6 m tall. Leaves 5.5-14 (-18) cm long and wide, shallowly 5-lobed or lobes lacking. Stipules minute. Inflorescences subcorymbose, often paired, up to 12 cm long; peduncle up to 7 cm long; petals greenish-yellow. Capsule 2.5-3 x 2 cm. Seeds 1.7 x 1 cm compressed, black.

Medium to large- sized tree with height of 8-30m, leaves are oblong- lanceolate, with size of 10-32 X 2-12 cm.Veins are prominent on lower face with tertiary nerves and reticulate veins. Young leaves are pendulous, purplish. Panicle size is within 6-40 cm, in general hairy. Sepals and Petals are ovoid- oblong and hairy. Yellow or purple veins. Fertile stamens as long as the corolla. Staminodes are very short. Fruits ovoid to ellipsoid, with oblique base, and size of 10-20 cm long.
treatments: Helps to keep heart healthy,Purifies blood.
